intro: Clompanus linearicarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit clompanus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream sides. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that splits open to release the seeds. Clompanus linearicarpa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
